description: Borrowed from Latin cōgitāt-, the perfect passive participial stem of the verb cōgitō (“I think”).

verbs.description: cogitate (third-person singular simple present cogitates, present participle cogitating, simple past and past participle cogitated)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To meditate, to ponder, to think deeply.
examples: He that calleth a thing into his mind, whether by impression or recordation, cogitateth and considereth, and he that employeth the faculty of his fancy also cogitateth.
